thag19.1:1.1: Oh, when will I stay in a mountain cave,
thag19.1:1.3: discerning all states of existence as impermanent?
thag19.1:1.4: This hope of mine, <j>when will it be?
thag19.1:2.1: Oh, when will I stay happily in the forest,
thag19.1:2.2: a sage wearing a torn robe, dressed in ocher,
thag19.1:2.3: unselfish, with no need for hope,
thag19.1:2.4: with greed, hate, and delusion destroyed?
thag19.1:3.1: Oh, when will I stay alone in the wood,
thag19.1:3.2: fearless, discerning this body as impermanent,
thag19.1:3.3: a nest of death and disease,
thag19.1:3.4: oppressed by death and old age; <j>when will it be?
thag19.1:4.1: Oh, when will I live, <j>having grasped the sharp sword of wisdom
thag19.1:4.2: and cut the creeper of craving <j>that tangles around everything,
thag19.1:4.3: the mother of fear, the bringer of suffering?
thag19.1:5.1: Oh, when will I, seated on the lion’s throne,
thag19.1:5.2: swiftly grasp the sword of the seers,
thag19.1:5.3: forged by wisdom, of fiery might,
thag19.1:5.4: and swiftly break Māra and his army? <j>When will it be?
thag19.1:6.1: Oh, when will I be seen in the assemblies
thag19.1:6.2: with those who are virtuous, unaffected, respecting the Dhamma,
thag19.1:6.3: seeing things as they are, with faculties subdued?
thag19.1:7.1: Oh, when will I focus on my heart’s goal <j>at the Mountainfold,
thag19.1:7.2: free of oppression by laziness, hunger, thirst,
thag19.1:8.1: Oh, when will I, serene and mindful,
thag19.1:8.3: that were realized by the great seer,
thag19.1:8.4: and are so very hard to see? <j>When will it be?
thag19.1:9.1: Oh, when will I, devoted to serenity,
thag19.1:9.2: see with understanding the infinite sights,
thag19.1:9.3: sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas
thag19.1:10.1: Oh, when will I not be distraught
thag19.1:11.1: Oh, when will I discern the aggregates
thag19.1:11.2: and the infinite varieties of phenomena,
thag19.1:11.3: both internal and external, as no more than
thag19.1:11.4: wood, grass, and creepers? <j>When will it be?
thag19.1:12.1: Oh, when will the monsoon clouds in season
thag19.1:12.2: freshly wet me in my robe in the forest,
thag19.1:12.3: walking the path trodden by the seers?
thag19.1:13.1: Oh, when will I rise up, <j>intent on attaining freedom from death,
thag19.1:13.3: the cry of the crested peacock in the forest?
thag19.1:14.1: Oh, when will I cross the Ganges, Yamunā,
thag19.1:14.2: and Sarasvatī rivers, the Pātāla country,
thag19.1:14.4: by psychic power unobstructed? When will it be?
thag19.1:15.1: Oh, when will I be devoted to absorption,
thag19.1:15.2: shunning all the signs of beauty,
thag19.1:15.3: splitting apart desire for sensual stimulation,
thag19.1:15.4: like an elephant that wanders free of ties? <j>When will it be?
thag19.1:16.1: Oh, when will I realize the teaching of the great seer
thag19.1:16.2: and be content, like a pauper in debt
thag19.1:16.3: harassed by creditors, who finds a hidden treasure?
thag19.1:17.1: For many years you begged me,
thag19.1:17.2: “Enough of living in a house for you!”
thag19.1:17.3: Why do you not urge me on, mind,
thag19.1:17.4: now that I’ve gone forth as an ascetic?
thag19.1:18.2: “On the Mountainfold, the birds with colorful wings,
thag19.1:18.4: will delight you as you meditate in the forest?”
thag19.1:19.1: In my family circle, friends, loved ones, and relatives;
thag19.1:19.2: and in the world, sports and play, <j>and sensual pleasures;
thag19.1:19.3: all these I gave up when I entered this life:
thag19.1:19.4: and even then you’re not content with me, mind!
thag19.1:20.1: This is mine alone, it doesn’t belong to others;
thag19.1:20.2: when it is time to don your armor, why lament?
thag19.1:20.3: Observing that all this is unstable,
thag19.1:20.4: I went forth, seeking the state free of death.
thag19.1:21.1: He whose words are well-composed , supreme among people,
thag19.1:21.2: great physician, <j>guide for those who wish to train, said:
thag19.1:21.4: so it’s very hard to control if you are not free of lust.”
thag19.1:22.1: Sensual pleasures are diverse, sweet, delightful;
thag19.1:22.2: an ignorant ordinary person is bound to them.
thag19.1:22.3: Seeking to be reborn again, they wish for suffering;
thag19.1:22.4: led on by their mind, they’re banished to hell.
thag19.1:23.1: “Staying in the grove resounding with cries
thag19.1:23.2: of peacocks and herons, <j>and adorned by leopards and tigers,
thag19.1:23.3: abandon concern for the body, without fail!”
thag19.1:23.4: So you used to urge me, mind.
thag19.1:24.2: the powers, awakening factors, and immersion;
thag19.1:24.3: realize the three knowledges <j>in the teaching of the Buddha!”
thag19.1:24.4: So you used to urge me, mind.
thag19.1:25.1: “Develop the eightfold path <j>to realize freedom from death
thag19.1:25.2: emancipating, plunging into the end of all suffering,
thag19.1:25.4: So you used to urge me, mind.
thag19.1:26.1: “Reflect rationally on the aggregates as suffering,
thag19.1:26.2: and abandon that from which suffering arises;
thag19.1:26.3: make an end of suffering in this very life!”
thag19.1:26.4: So you used to urge me, mind.
thag19.1:27.2: that emptiness is non-self, and that gloom is death.
thag19.1:27.4: So you used to urge me, mind.
thag19.1:28.2: seek alms amongst families, bowl in hand.
thag19.1:28.3: Devote yourself to the word of the teacher, <j>the great seer!”
thag19.1:28.4: So you used to urge me, mind.
thag19.1:29.2: mentally unchained to families and sensual pleasures,
thag19.1:29.3: like the full moon on a bright night!”
thag19.1:29.4: So you used to urge me, mind.
thag19.1:30.2: one who lives in charnel grounds, a rag-robe wearer,
thag19.1:30.3: one who never lies down, <j>always delighting in ascetic practices.”
thag19.1:30.4: So you used to urge me, mind.
thag19.1:31.1: Mind, when you urge me to the impermanent and unstable,
thag19.1:31.2: you’re acting like someone who plants trees,
thag19.1:31.3: then, when they’re about to fruit,
thag19.1:31.4: wishes to cut down the very same trees.
thag19.1:32.2: I won’t do your bidding any more.
thag19.1:32.3: Sensual pleasures are suffering, painful, <j>and very dangerous;
thag19.1:32.4: I’ll wander with my mind <j>focused only on extinguishment.
thag19.1:33.1: I didn’t go forth due to bad luck or shamelessness,
thag19.1:33.2: or due to a whim or banishment,
thag19.1:33.3: nor for the sake of a livelihood;
thag19.1:33.4: it was because I agreed <j>to the promise you made, mind.
thag19.1:34.2: the stilling of suffering: <j>these are praised by true persons.”
thag19.1:34.3: So you used to urge me, mind,
thag19.1:34.4: but now you keep on with your old habits!
thag19.1:35.1: Craving, ignorance, the loved and unloved,
thag19.1:35.3: and the delightful kinds of sensual stimulation:
thag19.1:35.4: I’ve vomited them up, I can’t swallow them back.
thag19.1:36.1: I’ve done your bidding everywhere, mind!
thag19.1:36.2: For many births, I’ve done nothing to upset you.
thag19.1:36.3: Yet the creation in myself <j>is because of your ingratitude—
thag19.1:36.4: for a long time I’ve transmigrated <j>in the suffering you’ve made.
thag19.1:37.1: Only you, mind, make a brahmin;
thag19.1:37.2: you make an aristocrat or a royal seer.
thag19.1:37.3: Sometimes we become peasants or menials;
thag19.1:37.4: and life as a god is also on account of you.
thag19.1:38.2: because of you we’re born in hell.
thag19.1:38.4: and life as a ghost is also on account of you.
thag19.1:39.1: Come what may, you won’t betray me again,
thag19.1:39.2: dazzling me with your ever-changing display!
thag19.1:39.3: You play with me like I’m mad—
thag19.1:39.4: but how have I ever failed you, mind?
thag19.1:40.1: In the past my mind wandered
thag19.1:40.2: how it wished, where it liked, as it pleased.
thag19.1:40.4: as a trainer with a hook guides a rutting elephant.
thag19.1:41.1: The teacher willed that this world appear to me
thag19.1:41.3: Mind, let me leap into the victor’s teaching,
thag19.1:41.4: carry me over the great flood, so hard to pass.
thag19.1:42.2: Nothing could make me return to your control!
thag19.1:42.3: I’ve gone forth in the teaching of the great seer,
thag19.1:42.4: those like me don’t come to ruin.
thag19.1:43.2: the four quarters, the intermediate directions, <j>below and in the sky;
thag19.1:43.3: the three realms of existence <j>are all impermanent and troubled—
thag19.1:43.4: where can you go to find happiness, mind?
thag19.1:44.1: Mind, what will you do to someone <j>who has made the ultimate commitment?
thag19.1:44.2: Nothing could make me a follower <j>under your control, mind;
thag19.1:44.3: I’d never touch a bellows <j>with a mouth open at each end;
thag19.1:44.4: curse this mortal frame flowing with nine streams!
thag19.1:45.1: You’ve ascended the mountain peak, <j>full of nature’s beauty,
thag19.1:45.3: a grove sprinkled with fresh water in the monsoon;
thag19.1:45.4: and there you’ll be happy in your cave-home.
thag19.1:46.1: Peacocks with beautiful necks and crests,
thag19.1:46.3: crying out at the resounding thunder:
thag19.1:46.4: they’ll delight you as you meditate in the forest.
thag19.1:47.1: When the heavens have rained, <j>and the grass is four inches high,
thag19.1:47.2: and the grove is full of flowers like a cloud,
thag19.1:47.3: between the mountains, like the fork of a tree, I’ll lie;
thag19.1:47.4: it will be as soft as cotton-buds.
thag19.1:48.1: I’ll act rather as a master does:
thag19.1:48.2: let whatever I get be enough for me.
thag19.1:48.3: And that’s why I’ll make you as supple
thag19.1:48.4: as a tireless worker makes a cat-skin bag.
thag19.1:49.1: I’ll act rather as a master does:
thag19.1:49.2: let whatever I get be enough for me.
thag19.1:49.3: I’ll control you with my energy,
thag19.1:49.4: as a skilled trainer controls an elephant with a hook.
thag19.1:50.1: Now that you’re well-tamed and reliable,
thag19.1:50.2: I can use you, <j>like a trainer uses a straight-running horse,
thag19.1:50.3: to practice the path of grace,
thag19.1:50.4: cultivated by those who take care of their minds.
thag19.1:51.1: I shall strongly fasten you to a meditation subject,
thag19.1:51.2: as an elephant is tied to a post with firm rope.
thag19.1:51.3: You’ll be well-guarded by me, <j>well-developed by mindfulness,
thag19.1:51.4: and unattached to rebirth in all states of existence.
thag19.1:52.1: With wisdom you’ll cut short <j>the one following the wrong path,
thag19.1:52.2: curb them by meditation, <j>and settle them on the right path.
thag19.1:52.3: Having seen arising and passing away <j>with respect to the cause of suffering,
thag19.1:52.4: you’ll be an heir to the greatest teacher.
thag19.1:53.1: Under the sway of the four distortions, mind,
thag19.1:53.2: you dragged me around like a bull in a pit;
thag19.1:53.3: but now you won’t associate <j>with the great sage of compassion,
thag19.1:53.4: the cutter of fetters and bonds?
thag19.1:54.1: Like a deer roaming free in the colorful forest,
thag19.1:54.2: I’ll ascend the lovely mountain <j>wreathed in monsoon clouds,
thag19.1:54.3: and rejoice to be on that hill, free of folk—
thag19.1:54.4: there is no doubt you’ll perish, mind.
thag19.1:55.1: The men and women who live <j>under your will and command,
thag19.1:55.3: they are ignorant and fall under Māra’s control;
thag19.1:55.4: loving life, they’re your disciples, mind.
